title: Dual Rate Count Supervisor
description:
Overview:

Whether you want to make your debut or go back on tour after a long hiatus, starting a career at Rideau Carleton Casino can be very rewarding. This property is the premier Gaming entertainment destination of Ottawa & features the hottest slot machines. Owned & operated by Hard Rock International, this electrifying casino destination boasts three delicious restaurants.

 

OUR COMMITMENT TO SERVICE:    

We donâ€™t have customers, we have Guests. Unparalleled Service isnâ€™t just a part of our mission statement at Rideau Carleton Casino; itâ€™s a commitment to each and every one of our current & future Guests. We offer rockin' benefits that include Medical, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance options, generous Paid Time Off & much more!  

Responsibilities:

The Dual Count Supervisor is responsible for the supervision of the soft drop and count team.   He or she has a strong presence on the gaming floor, supporting the management of people and interacting with customers while delivering exceptional customer service. When the individual is not performing supervisory tasks, they are working in a Count Attendant role.

  • Ensures adherence to internal controls and assist in the development and continual improvement of count room operational procedures.
  • Works with the Manager to develop drop schedules and routes that result in the most efficient collection of drop boxes
  • Assist with the development of team member schedules designed to meet business needs for all subordinate positions.
  • Assist with ensuring accurate payroll processing for all subordinate staff.
  • Assist with ensuring adequate inventories of all operational supplies.
  • Interact with vendors and members of other departments in a professional manner on the phone, via email and in person
  • Assist with writing staff evaluations.
  • Develop department membersâ€™ knowledge and skills through education, training and coaching. Work with team members to assist in their personal and professional growth which will result in an effective management succession process.
  • Demonstrate a commitment to ensuring responsible gaming and responsible alcohol service by discreetly notifying appropriate management of concerns and observations.
  • Conduct personal behavior and select, train, coach, counsel, appraise and retain direct reports who consistently perform actions and behaviors that reinforce the Companyâ€™s Mission and Values of Communication, Integrity, Fun, Respect, Accountability, Passion and Dedication.

  • Lives the Brand

  • One or more years of experience in a leadership role
  • A strong mathematical aptitude, managerial skills and familiarity with a high-volume, fast paced, shift-work environment
  • A working knowledge of computer software and the ability to learn new software and systems
  • The ability to obtain registration as a Category 1 Gaming Assistant with the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario

SKILLS

  • Strong organizational, interpersonal, analytical, communication and managerial skills
  • Communication, problem-solving, decision-making, prioritization, and analytical skills required
  • Ability to work flexible schedules, including nights, weekends and holidays is required
  • Ability to work and contribute in a team environment under tight deadlines

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Ability to stand and sit for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to walk distances.
  • The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
  • Duties and responsibilities are typically performed in a professional office setting, but there may be times where you will need to be on the Casino Floor or pass through this area. On the Casino Floor, you may be exposed to casino-related environmental factors including, but not limited to, excessive noise.

title: Summer Lift Operator
company: Sun Peaks Resort LLP/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel & Conference Centre
description:
Work, Live and Play

Sun Peaks Resort LLP has proven to be one of the highest levels of guest service providers within the ski industry. We can promise you a memorable and gainful working experience within our high volume and challenging work environments. Sun Peaks Resort LLP has many benefits to offer our employees including:

  • Full access Summer Alpine Hike and Downhill Bike season pass
  • Employee access to Golf Membership and discounted Golf Cart season pass
  • Employee Health and Wellness Program including EFAP services
  • Companywide discounts and benefit programs 
  • Eligibility to participate in our Peak Performer Recognition Program, awarded at the end of our summer season at a specially planned event
  • Reciprocal riding at other participating BC and Alberta bike parks

Role Overview:

Lift Operators are key guest-facing members of our summer operations team at Sun Peaks Resort. In collaboration with the Lift Operations and Lift Maintenance teams, this role has a shared responsibility for ensuring the lifts' safe operations, including safety checks, safe loading and unloading practices for guests, and continued upkeep of a clean work area free from obstructions.

This role will be stationed at the Conveyer lift, providing guests access to our popular Progression Park where new riders learn to perfect their skills before progressing up the mountain. The incumbent will receive full training and will work alongside skilled and knowledgeable individuals.

Your Responsibilities will include:

  • Assisting the Lift Maintenance team with routine start-up and safety checks
  • Practice all safety measures to ensure all guests load and unload in a safe manner
  • Provide extra assistance to those guests requiring help
  • Continued upkeep of all workstations and ensure all areas are free from any obstruction
  • Work as part of the lift operations team to ensure all safety practices are being followed by employees and guests

Ideal Candidate:

  • Strong team player eager to work collaboratively within the team and with other departments.
  • Task focused with a safety-first mindset
  • Highly motivated and outgoing with a sincere willingness to provide a special guest experience
  • Keen willingness to learn from others
  • Open and transparent communication skills
  • High level of physical fitness, free from injuries
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
  • Willing and able to work outdoors in all weather conditions for the majority of a day.

Incentive Program:

If you are a student, currently enrolled in a college/university tourism and/or hospitality program, please note, that this role is eligible for fully reimbursed staff accommodation for the Summer season for successful applicants.

Please ensure you provide the required documentation and complete the information on your student status in the job application fields. (Conditions apply and will be discussed in detail with successful applicants during the interview and at the job offer stage).

If you have been referred by a current employee of Sun Peaks Resort/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel (or someone who has an accepted job offer for the Summer 2022 start), please ensure you indicate their name and current department in the required field in your application form.

  • Highly motivated and outgoing with a sincere willingness to provide a special guest experience

  • Open and transparent communication skills

description:
Overview:

Under the direction of the Operations Manager, ensure that floods are done on time with safety being a prime concern. Primary responsibilities include ice resurfacing, edging, janitorial work & (Tâ€™s) ice plant, log readings, & some HVAC troubleshooting.

Responsibilities:
  • Flooding, edging and other ongoing maintenance of ice as scheduled.
  • (T) Monitor the ice plant regularly, keeping appropriate notes / records or reports.
  • Completes all log reports as required
  • Performs maintenance as may be required for the daily operation of the Zamboni: changing and toping up fluids, greasing, changing of blades, and other general maintenance.  
  • Perform a variety of maintenance & repairs on and around the rinks, which may include changing boards, glass, painting, and other minor repairs. Capable of handling power and hand tools safely.
  • Do minor maintenance on facility and ice maintenance equipment.
  • Participates in keeping all areas of the facility neat, tidy and safe at all times. Inside and outside of the property
  • Dressing room cleanliness.
  • Making sure that all entrances are kept clean and safe of all debris and snow.
  • Responding to customersâ€™ needs in a kind and courteous manner.
  • A team member, supporting and contributing throughout the facility and the business.
  • To look out for the safety of yourself, co-workers, guests and to follow all Health and Safety requirements in the workplace.
  • Read and understand WHMIS SDS (Safety Data Sheets)
  • All other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • A minimum of 1-year experience in the above field is preferred.
  • Arena Operator Level 1 is asset.
  • Basic computer knowledge and skills preferred
  • Ability to operate a Zamboni
  • Ability to use various equipment and tools common to the role and the facility.
  • Mechanical aptitude & all-around knowledge of mechanical equipment.
  • Possess a positive work ethic and the ability to work with / communicate with Customers.
  • Must work well with peers and Management.
  • Must be able to follow directions, written and oral.
  • Must have good organization skills and good communication skills
  • Flexible with respect to shifts, ability to work evenings, weekends, graveyard and days.
  • Must be physically fit and able to lift and carry equipment and other materials.
  • Works with Chemicals, Fuels and other combustibles.

Extended hours during the week and on weekends is required.

title: Lift Operator
description:
POSITION: Lift Operator/Attendant DEPARTMENT: Mountain Operations REPORTS TO: Manager Mountain Operations STATUS OF POSITION: Seasonal JOIN US FOR THE 2022 SUMMER SEASON! WHO WE ARE: At Horseshoe Resort, we are a team that loves to serve people, priding ourselves on the service that our colleagues deliver to our guests
Horseshoe Resort is always looking for talented individuals to join our growing team of hospitality professionals and recreation enthusiasts
If you are outgoing, friendly and love adventure and the outdoors, you may be the person we are looking for! Position Summary The Lift Operators are responsible operating the alpine lifts in a safe and courteous manner
Working alone or in pairs, they need to ensure guests board, ride and disembark the lift according to safety standards
This includes successfully completing and passing a lift operations training session and exam, and applying what is learned consistently
Lift Operators ensure tools, loading and unloading areas, and lift huts are kept tidy and organized
They greet guests in a friendly manner and assist guests with any questions they may have
Just like all Horseshoe Resort Colleagues, Lift Operators are responsible for ensuring the health and safety of themselves, fellow colleagues and guests
Duties and Responsibilities: Operator: Ensure that guests board, ride and disembark the lift according to safety standards Greet, acknowledge and assist guests in a courteous manner Verify that guests have the appropriate lift tickets purchased for the lift Engage with guests Attendant: Greet, acknowledge and assist guests in a courteous manner Verify that guests have the appropriate lift tickets purchased for the lift Engage with guests Involved with line control at the lift Will always be working with an operator who will be controlling the equipment Qualifications: Attendant minimum age: 14 Operator minimum age: 16 Ability to be on your feet for up to 8 hours, while standing outdoors in all weather conditions (cold, windy, raining)
Be able to move up and down the stairs
Be flexible with their schedule, working weekend shifts, some day and evening shifts
Be able to twist, bend and reach while paying sustained attention to the operation of the lift and the movements of the guests
Join our team today, and enjoy employee perks such as Resort staff pass for yourself and your dependents, retail, lodging, and restaurant discounts, along with additional perks and discounts at our other affiliated resort – Deerhurst Resort in Muskoka

title: Banff Gondola, Lift Attendant $16/hr
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?

Greeting, advising and assisting guests with the loading and unloading of gondolas, while providing them with a high quality experience and outstanding customer service 

What perks can you expect?

  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe 
  • Work experience in an iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location 
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuit’s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an inclusive culture and make life-long friends 
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth or future work at other Pursuit locations 
  • Access to one of the world’s most beautiful and iconic National Parks 

What will you do in this job?

  • Adhering to all safety and operational policies and procedures
  • Ensuring that each customer interaction is friendly and professional
  • Advising of any potentially dangerous mechanical or operational hazards
  • Familiar with operational and emergency policies and procedures
  • Maintain orderly traffic conditions in the terminals
  • Ensuring that the terminal and staff room are kept orderly and well maintained
  • Cleaning the interior and exterior of gondolas
  • Assisting in lift maintenance as required

What skills and experience do you need for this job?

  • Strong customer service skills
  • Demands physical activity for the entire work day
  • Proven ability to work within strict policy/procedures and guidelines
  • Lift operations experience an asset
  • First Aid Training and Driver’s license an asset
  • To honour our Always Honest policy all employees must consent to a criminal and credit cheque 

What will your work environment be like?

  • Beautiful. You’ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring locations. You’ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. You’ll participate in team events – and fun! 
  • Independent. You’ll spend your days in and around National Parks
  • Remote. Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog. Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of through WiFi 
  • Busy. You need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required 
  • Full time and part time positions available

This job description describes this role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up. We work as a team and believe that we succeed together – these job duties may change based on the needs of the team and company as a whole. 

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in Canada is required.
